properties.name: value
properties.doc: The value displayed as text by this control.

properties.name: raw
properties.doc: If set to True, the component renders as an HTML <span> element without any default style.

properties.name: mode
properties.doc:
Define the way the text is processed:
  • "raw": synonym for setting the *raw* property to True
  • "pre": keeps spaces and new lines
  • "markdown" or "md": basic support for Markdown.

properties.name: format
properties.doc:
The format to apply to the value.
See below.

properties.name: label
properties.doc: The label displayed in the button.

properties.name: on_action
properties.doc:
The name of a function that is triggered when the button is pressed.
The parameters of that function are all optional:
  • state (State^): the state instance.
  • id (optional[str]): the identifier of the button.
  • payload (dict): a dictionary that contains the key "action" set to the name of the action that triggered this callback.

properties.name: value
properties.doc: The value represented by this control.

properties.name: password
properties.doc: If True, the text is obscured: all input characters are displayed as an asterisk ('*').

properties.name: label
properties.doc: The label associated with the input.

properties.name: multiline
properties.doc: If True, the text is presented as a multi line input.

properties.name: lines_shown
properties.doc: The height of the displayed element if multiline is True.

properties.name: type
properties.doc: TODO: The type of input: text, tel, email ... as defined in HTML standards https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/input#input_types

properties.name: value
properties.doc: The numerical value represented by this control.

properties.name: label
properties.doc: The label associated with the input.

properties.name: step
properties.doc: The amount by which the value is incremented or decremented when the user clicks one of the arrow buttons.

properties.name: step_multiplier
properties.doc: A factor that multiplies step when the user presses the Shift key while clicking one of the arrow buttons.

properties.name: min
properties.doc: The minimum value to accept for this input.

properties.name: max
properties.doc: The maximum value to accept for this input.

properties.name: value
properties.doc:
The value that is set for this slider.
If this slider is based on a lov then this property can be set to the lov element.
This value can also hold an array of numbers to indicate that the slider reflects a range (within the [min,max] domain) defined by several knobs that the user can set independently.
If this slider is based on a lov then this property can be set to an array of lov elements. The slider is then represented with several knobs, one for each lov value.

properties.name: min
properties.doc:
The minimum value.
This is ignored when lov is defined.

properties.name: max
properties.doc:
The maximum value.
This is ignored when lov is defined.

properties.name: step
properties.doc:
The step value: the gap between two consecutive values the slider set. It is a good practice to have (max-min) being divisible by step.
This property is ignored when lov is defined.

properties.name: text_anchor
properties.doc:
When the lov property is used, this property indicates the location of the label.
Possible values are:
  • "bottom"
  • "top"
  • "left"
  • "right"
  • "none" (no label is displayed)

properties.name: labels
properties.doc:
The labels for specific points of the slider.
If set to True, this slider uses the labels of the lov if there are any.
If set to a dictionary, the slider uses the dictionary keys as a lov key or index, and the associated value as the label.

properties.name: continuous
properties.doc:
If set to False, the control emits an on_change notification only when the mouse button is released, otherwise notifications are emitted during the cursor movements.
If lov is defined, the default value is False.

properties.name: change_delay
properties.doc:
Minimum time between triggering two on_change callbacks.
The default value is defined at the application configuration level by the change_delay configuration option. if None or 0, there's no delay.

properties.name: width
properties.doc: The width, in CSS units, of this element.

properties.name: height
properties.doc:
The height, in CSS units, of this element.
It defaults to the width value when using the vertical orientation.

properties.name: orientation
properties.doc:
The orientation of this slider.
Valid values are "horizontal" or "vertical".

properties.name: theme
properties.doc: If set, this toggle control acts as a way to set the application Theme (dark or light).

properties.name: allow_unselect
properties.doc: If set, this allows de-selection and the value is set to unselected_value.

properties.name: unselected_value
properties.doc: Value assigned to value when no item is selected.

properties.name: mode
properties.doc:
Define the way the toggle is displayed:
  • "theme": synonym for setting the *theme* property to True

properties.name: date
properties.doc:
The date that this control represents and can modify.
It is typically bound to a datetime object.

properties.name: with_time
properties.doc: Whether or not to show the time part of the date.

properties.name: format
properties.doc: The format to apply to the value. See below.

properties.name: editable
properties.doc: Shows the date as a formatted string if not editable.

properties.name: label
properties.doc: The label associated with the input.

properties.name: min
properties.doc: The minimum date to accept for this input.

properties.name: max
properties.doc: The maximum date to accept for this input.

properties.name: dates
properties.doc:
The dates that this control represents and can modify.
It is typically bound to a list of two datetime object.

properties.name: with_time
properties.doc: Whether or not to show the time part of the date.

properties.name: format
properties.doc: The format to apply to the value. See below.

properties.name: editable
properties.doc: Shows the date as a formatted string if not editable.

properties.name: label_start
properties.doc: The label associated with the first input.

properties.name: label_end
properties.doc: The label associated with the second input.

properties.name: data
properties.doc:
The data object bound to this chart control.
See the section on the data property below for details.

properties.name: type
properties.doc:
Chart type.
See the Plotly chart type documentation for details.

properties.name: mode
properties.doc:
Chart mode.
See the Plotly chart mode documentation for details.

properties.name: x
properties.doc: Column name for the x axis.

properties.name: y
properties.doc: Column name for the y axis.

properties.name: z
properties.doc: Column name for the z axis.

properties.name: lon
properties.doc: Column name for the longitude value, for 'scattergeo' charts. See Plotly Map traces.

properties.name: lat
properties.doc: Column name for the latitude value, for 'scattergeo' charts. See Plotly Map traces.

properties.name: r
properties.doc: Column name for the r value, for 'scatterpolar' charts. See Plotly Polar charts.

properties.name: theta
properties.doc: Column name for the theta value, for 'scatterpolar' charts. See Plotly Polar charts.

properties.name: high
properties.doc: Column name for the high value, for 'candlestick' charts. See Plotly Candlestick charts.

properties.name: low
properties.doc: Column name for the low value, for 'candlestick' charts. See Ploty Candlestick charts.

properties.name: open
properties.doc: Column name for the open value, for 'candlestick' charts. See Plotly Candlestick charts.

properties.name: close
properties.doc: Column name for the close value, for 'candlestick' charts. See Plotly Candlestick charts.

properties.name: measure
properties.doc: Column name for the measure value, for 'waterfall' charts. See Plotly Waterfall charts.

properties.name: locations
properties.doc: Column name for the locations value. See Plotly Choropleth maps.

properties.name: values
properties.doc: Column name for the values value. See Plotly Pie charts or Plotly Funnel Area charts.

properties.name: labels
properties.doc: Column name for the labels value. See Plotly Pie charts.

properties.name: parents
properties.doc: Column name for the parents value. See Plotly Treemap charts.

properties.name: text
properties.doc:
Column name for the text associated to the point for the indicated trace.
This is meaningful only when mode has the text option.

properties.name: base
properties.doc:
Column name for the base value. Used in bar charts only.
See the Plotly bar chart base documentation for details."

properties.name: title
properties.doc: The title of this chart control.

properties.name: render
properties.doc: If True, this chart is visible on the page.

properties.name: on_range_change
properties.doc:
The callback function that is invoked when the visible part of the x axis changes.
The function receives three parameters:
  • state (State^): the state instance.
  • id (optional[str]): the identifier of the chart control.
  • payload (dict[str, any]): the full details on this callback's invocation, as emitted by Plotly.

properties.name: columns
properties.doc:
The list of column names
  • str: ;-separated list of column names
  • list[str]: list of names
  • dict: {"column_name": {format: "format", index: 1}} if index is specified, it represents the display order of the columns. If not, the list order defines the index

properties.name: label
properties.doc:
The label for the indicated trace.
This is used when the mouse hovers over a trace.

properties.name: name
properties.doc: The name of the indicated trace.

properties.name: selected
properties.doc: The list of the selected point indices  .

properties.name: color
properties.doc: The color of the indicated trace (or a column name for scattered).

properties.name: selected_color
properties.doc: The color of the selected points for the indicated trace.

properties.name: marker
properties.doc:
The type of markers used for the indicated trace.
See marker for details.
Color, opacity, size and symbol can be column name.

properties.name: line
properties.doc:
The configuration of the line used for the indicated trace.
See line for details.
If the value is a string, it must be a dash type or pattern (see dash style of lines for details).

properties.name: selected_marker
properties.doc:
The type of markers used for selected points in the indicated trace.
See selected marker for details.

properties.name: layout
properties.doc: The plotly.js compatible layout object.

properties.name: plot_config
properties.doc: The plotly.js compatible configuration options object.

properties.name: options
properties.doc: The plotly.js compatible data object where dynamic data will be overridden..

properties.name: orientation
properties.doc: The orientation of the indicated trace.

properties.name: text_anchor
properties.doc:
Position of the text relative to the point.
Valid values are: top, bottom, left, and right.

properties.name: xaxis
properties.doc: The x axis identifier for the indicated trace.

properties.name: yaxis
properties.doc: The y axis identifier for the indicated trace.

properties.name: width
properties.doc: The width, in CSS units, of this element.

properties.name: height
properties.doc: The height, in CSS units, of this element.

properties.name: template
properties.doc: The Plotly layout template.

properties.name: template[dark]
properties.doc: The Plotly layout template applied over the base template when theme is dark.

properties.name: template[light]
properties.doc: The Plotly layout template applied over the base template when theme is not dark.

properties.name: decimator
properties.doc:
A decimator instance for the indicated trace that reduces the volume of the data being sent back and forth.
If defined as indexed, it impacts only the indicated trace; if not, it applies to the first trace only.

properties.name: rebuild
properties.doc: Allows dynamic config refresh if set to True.

properties.name: figure
properties.doc: A figure as produced by plotly.

properties.name: data
properties.doc: The data to be represented in this table. This property can be indexed to define other data for comparison.

properties.name: page_size
properties.doc: For a paginated table, the number of visible rows.

properties.name: allow_all_rows
properties.doc: For a paginated table, adds an option to show all the rows.

properties.name: show_all
properties.doc: For a paginated table, show all the rows.

properties.name: auto_loading
properties.doc: If True, the data will be loaded on demand.

properties.name: width[column_name]
properties.doc: The width, in CSS units, of the indicated column.

properties.name: selected
properties.doc: The list of the indices of the rows to be displayed as selected.

properties.name: page_size_options
properties.doc: The list of available page sizes that users can choose from.

properties.name: columns
properties.doc:
The list of the column names to display.
  • str: Semicolon (';')-separated list of column names.
  • list[str]: The list of column names.
  • dict: A dictionary with entries matching: {"col name": {format: "format", index: 1}}.
    if index is specified, it represents the display order of the columns. If index is not specified, the list order defines the index.
    If format is specified, it is used for numbers or dates.

properties.name: date_format
properties.doc: The date format used for all date columns when the format is not specifically defined.

properties.name: number_format
properties.doc: The number format used for all number columns when the format is not specifically defined.

properties.name: group_by[column_name]
properties.doc:
Indicates, if True, that the given column can be aggregated.
See below for details.

properties.name: apply[column_name]
properties.doc:
The name of the aggregation function to use.
This is used only if group_by[column_name] is set to True.
See below for details.

properties.name: style
properties.doc:
Allows the styling of table lines.
See below for details.

properties.name: style[column_name]
properties.doc:
Allows the styling of table cells.
See below for details.

properties.name: tooltip
properties.doc:
The name of the function that must return a tooltip text for a cell.
See below for details.

properties.name: tooltip[column_name]
properties.doc:
The name of the function that must return a tooltip text for a cell.
See below for details.

properties.name: width
properties.doc: The width, in CSS units, of this table control.

properties.name: height
properties.doc: The height, in CSS units, of this table control.

properties.name: filter
properties.doc: Indicates, if True, that all columns can be filtered.

properties.name: filter[column_name]
properties.doc: Indicates, if True, that the indicated column can be filtered.

properties.name: nan_value
properties.doc: The replacement text for NaN (not-a-number) values.

properties.name: nan_value[column_name]
properties.doc: The replacement text for NaN (not-a-number) values for the indicated column.

properties.name: editable
properties.doc: Indicates, if True, that all columns can be edited.

properties.name: editable[column_name]
properties.doc: Indicates, if False, that the indicated column cannot be edited when editable is True.

properties.name: on_edit
properties.doc:
TODO: Default implementation and False value. The name of a function that is triggered when a cell edition is validated.
All parameters of that function are optional:
  • state (State^): the state instance.
  • var_name (str): the name of the tabular data variable.
  • payload (dict): the details on this callback's invocation.
    This dictionary has the following keys:
    • index (int): the row index.
    • col (str): the column name.
    • value (any): the new cell value cast to the type of the column.
    • user_value (str): the new cell value, as it was provided by the user.
    • tz (str): the timezone if the column type is date.

If this property is not set, the user cannot edit cells.

properties.name: on_delete
properties.doc:
TODO: Default implementation and False value. The name of a function that is triggered when a row is deleted.
All parameters of that function are optional:
  • state (State^): the state instance.
  • var_name (str): the name of the tabular data variable.
  • payload (dict): the details on this callback's invocation.
    This dictionary has the following keys:
    • index (int): the row index.

If this property is not set, the user cannot delete rows.

properties.name: on_add
properties.doc:
TODO: Default implementation and False value. The name of a function that is triggered when the user requests a row to be added.
All parameters of that function are optional:
  • state (State^): the state instance.
  • var_name (str): the name of the tabular data variable.
  • payload (dict): the details on this callback's invocation.
    This dictionary has the following keys:
    • index (int): the row index.

If this property is not set, the user cannot add rows.

properties.name: on_action
properties.doc:
The name of a function that is triggered when the user selects a row.
All parameters of that function are optional:
  • state (State^): the state instance.
  • var_name (str): the name of the tabular data variable.
  • payload (dict): the details on this callback's invocation.
    This dictionary has the following keys:
    • action: the name of the action that triggered this callback.
    • index (int): the row index.
    • col (str): the column name.
    • reason (str): the origin of the action: "click", or "button" if the cell contains a Markdown link syntax.
    • value (str): the *link value* indicated in the cell when using a Markdown link syntax (that is, reason is set to "button").
.

properties.name: size
properties.doc:
The size of the rows.
Valid values are "small" and "medium".

properties.name: rebuild
properties.doc: If set to True, this allows to dynamically refresh the  columns.

properties.name: lov[column_name]
properties.doc: The list of values of the indicated column.

properties.name: downloadable
properties.doc: If True, a clickable icon is shown so the user can download the data as CSV.

properties.name: on_compare
properties.doc: A data comparison function that would return a structure that identifies the differences between the different data passed as name. The default implementation compares the default data with the data[1] value.

properties.name: label
properties.doc: The label associated with the selector when in dropdown mode.

properties.name: mode
properties.doc:
Define the way the selector is displayed:
  • "radio": list of radio buttons
  • "check": list of check buttons
  • any other value: selector as usual.

properties.name: dropdown
properties.doc:
If True, the list of items is shown in a dropdown menu.

You cannot use the filter in that situation.

properties.name: multiple
properties.doc: If True, the user can select multiple items.

properties.name: filter
properties.doc: If True, this control is combined with a filter input area.

properties.name: width
properties.doc: The width, in CSS units, of this element.

properties.name: height
properties.doc: The height, in CSS units, of this element.

properties.name: content
properties.doc:
The content to transfer.
If this is a string, a URL, or a file, then the content is read from this source.
If a readable buffer is provided (such as an array of bytes...), and to prevent the bandwidth from being consumed too much, the way the data is transferred depends on the data_url_max_size parameter of the application configuration (which is set to 50kB by default):
  • If the buffer size is smaller than this setting, then the raw content is generated as a data URL, encoded using base64 (i.e. "data:<mimetype>;base64,<data>").
  • If the buffer size exceeds this setting, then it is transferred through a temporary file.
If this property is set to None, that indicates that dynamic content is generated. Please take a look at the examples below for details on dynamic generation.

properties.name: label
properties.doc: The label of the button.

properties.name: on_action
properties.doc:
The name of a function that is triggered when the download is terminated (or on user action if content is None).
All the parameters of that function are optional:
  • state (State^): the state instance.
  • id (optional[str]): the identifier of the button.
  • payload (dict): the details on this callback's invocation.
    This dictionary has two keys:
    • action: the name of the action that triggered this callback.
    • args: A list of two elements: args[0] reflects the name property and args[1] holds the file URL.

properties.name: auto
properties.doc: If True, the download starts as soon as the page is loaded.

properties.name: render
properties.doc:
If True, the control is displayed.
If False, the control is not displayed.

properties.name: bypass_preview
properties.doc:
If False, allows the browser to try to show the content in a different tab.
The file download is always performed.

properties.name: name
properties.doc: A name proposition for the file to save, that the user can change.

properties.name: content
properties.doc: The path or the list of paths of the uploaded files.

properties.name: label
properties.doc: The label of the button.

properties.name: on_action
properties.doc:
The name of the function that will be triggered.
All the parameters of that function are optional:
  • state (State^): the state instance.
  • id (optional[str]): the identifier of the button.
  • payload (dict): a dictionary that contains the key "action" set to the name of the action that triggered this callback.

properties.name: multiple
properties.doc: If set to True, multiple files can be uploaded.

properties.name: extensions
properties.doc: The list of file extensions that can be uploaded.

properties.name: drop_message
properties.doc: The message that is displayed when the user drags a file above the button.

properties.name: notify
properties.doc: If set to False, the user won't be notified of upload finish.

properties.name: content
properties.doc:
The image source.
If a buffer is provided (string, array of bytes...), and in order to prevent the bandwidth to be consumed too much, the way the image data is transferred depends on the data_url_max_size parameter of the application configuration (which is set to 50kB by default):
  • If the size of the buffer is smaller than this setting, then the raw content is generated as a data URL, encoded using base64 (i.e. "data:<mimetype>;base64,<data>").
  • If the size of the buffer is greater than this setting, then it is transferred through a temporary file.

properties.name: label
properties.doc: The label for this image.

properties.name: on_action
properties.doc:
The name of a function that is triggered when the user clicks on the image.
All the parameters of that function are optional:
  • state (State^): the state instance.
  • id (optional[str]): the identifier of the button.
  • payload (dict): a dictionary that contains the key "action" set to the name of the action that triggered this callback.

properties.name: width
properties.doc: The width, in CSS units, of this element.

properties.name: height
properties.doc: The height, in CSS units, of this element.

properties.name: value
properties.doc: The value to display.

properties.name: type
properties.doc:
The type of the gauge.
Possible values are:
  • "none"
  • "circular"
  • "linear"
.

properties.name: title
properties.doc: The title of the metric.

properties.name: min
properties.doc: The minimum value of this metric control.

properties.name: max
properties.doc: The maximum value of this metric control.

properties.name: delta
properties.doc: The delta value to display.

properties.name: delta_color
properties.doc: The color that is used to display the value of the delta property. If negative_delta_color is set, then this property applies for positive values of delta only. If this property is set to "invert", then delta values are represented with the color used for negative values if delta is positive. The value for delta is also represented with the color used for positive values if delta is negative.

properties.name: negative_delta_color
properties.doc: If set, this represents the color to be used when the value of delta is negative (or positive if delta_color is set to "invert")

properties.name: threshold
properties.doc: The threshold value to display.

properties.name: show_value
properties.doc: If set to False, the value is not displayed.

properties.name: format
properties.doc:
The format to use when displaying the value.
This uses the printf syntax.

properties.name: delta_format
properties.doc:
The format to use when displaying the delta value.
This uses the printf syntax.

properties.name: color_map
properties.doc: TODO The color_map is used to display different colors for different ranges of the metric. The color_map's keys represent the starting point of each range, which is a number, while the values represent the corresponding color for that range. If the value associated with a key is set to None, it implies that the corresponding range is not assigned any color.

properties.name: width
properties.doc: The width, in CSS units, of the metric.

properties.name: height
properties.doc: The height, in CSS units, of the metric.

properties.name: template
properties.doc: The Plotly layout template.

properties.name: template[dark]
properties.doc: The Plotly layout template applied over the base template when theme is dark.

properties.name: template[light]
properties.doc: The Plotly layout template applied over the base template when theme is not dark.

properties.name: value
properties.doc: If set, then the value represents the progress percentage that is shown.TODO - if unset?

properties.name: linear
properties.doc: If set to True, the control displays a linear progress indicator instead of a circular one.

properties.name: show_value
properties.doc: If set to True, the progress value is shown.

properties.name: render
properties.doc: If False, this progress indicator is hidden from the page.

properties.name: display
properties.doc:
The label to be displayed.
This can be formatted if it is a numerical value.

properties.name: value
properties.doc: The location of the label on the [min, max] range.

properties.name: min
properties.doc: The minimum value of the range.

properties.name: max
properties.doc: The maximum value of the range.

properties.name: format
properties.doc:
The format to use when displaying the value.
This uses the printf syntax.

properties.name: orientation
properties.doc: The orientation of this slider.

properties.name: width
properties.doc: The width, in CSS units, of the indicator (used when orientation is horizontal).

properties.name: height
properties.doc: The height, in CSS units, of the indicator (used when orientation is vertical).

properties.name: lov
properties.doc: The list of menu option values.

properties.name: adapter
properties.doc: The function that transforms an element of lov into a tuple(id:str, label:str|Icon).

properties.name: type
properties.doc:
Must be specified if lov contains a non specific type of data (ex: dict).
value must be of that type, lov must be an iterable on this type, and the adapter function will receive an object of this type.

properties.name: label
properties.doc: The title of the menu.

properties.name: inactive_ids
properties.doc: Semicolon (';')-separated list or a list of menu items identifiers that are disabled.

properties.name: width
properties.doc:
The width, in CSS units, of the menu when unfolded.
Note that when running on a mobile device, the property width[active] is used instead.

properties.name: width[mobile]
properties.doc: The width, in CSS units, of the menu when unfolded, on a mobile device.

properties.name: on_action
properties.doc:
The name of the function that is triggered when a menu option is selected.

All the parameters of that function are optional:
  • state (State^): the state instance.
  • id (str): the identifier of the button.
  • payload (dict): the details on this callback's invocation.
    This dictionary has the following keys:
    • action: the name of the action that triggered this callback.
    • args: List where the first element contains the id of the selected option.

properties.name: lov
properties.doc:
The list of pages. The keys should be:
  • page id (start with "/")
  • or full URL
The values are labels. See the section on List of Values for details.

properties.name: value
properties.doc: The different status items to represent. See below.

properties.name: without_close
properties.doc: If True, the user cannot remove the status items from the list.

properties.name: title
properties.doc: The title of the login dialog.

properties.name: on_action
properties.doc:
The name of the function that is triggered when the dialog button is pressed.

All the parameters of that function are optional:
  • state (State^): the state instance.
  • id (str): the identifier of the button.
  • payload (dict): the details on this callback's invocation.
    This dictionary has the following keys:
    • action: the name of the action that triggered this callback.
    • args: a list with three elements:
      • The first element is the username
      • The second element is the password
      • The third element is the current page name

When the button is pressed, and if this property is not set, Taipy will try to find a callback function called on_login() and invoke it with the parameters listed above.

properties.name: message
properties.doc: The message shown in the dialog.

properties.name: messages
properties.doc: The list of messages. Each element is a list composed of an id, a message and an user identifier.

properties.name: users
properties.doc: The list of users. See the section on List of Values for details.

properties.name: on_action
properties.doc:
The name of a function that is triggered when the user enters a new message.
All parameters of that function are optional:
  • state (State^): the state instance.
  • var_name (str): the name of the messages variable.
  • payload (dict): the details on this callback's invocation.
    This dictionary has the following keys:
    • action: the name of the action that triggered this callback.
    • args (list): A list composed of a reason (click or Enter), variable name, message, sender id.
.

properties.name: with_input
properties.doc: If True, the input field is visible.

properties.name: sender_id
properties.doc: The user id associated with the message sent from the input

properties.name: height
properties.doc: The maximum height, in CSS units, of this element.

properties.name: page_size
properties.doc: The number of rows retrieved on the frontend.

properties.name: expanded
properties.doc: If Boolean and False, only one node can be expanded at one given level. Otherwise this should be set to an array of the node identifiers that need to be expanded.

properties.name: multiple
properties.doc: If True, the user can select multiple items by holding the Ctrl key while clicking on items.

properties.name: select_leafs_only
properties.doc: If True, the user can only select leaf nodes.

properties.name: row_height
properties.doc: The height, in CSS units, of each row.

properties.name: render
properties.doc:
If True, this part is visible on the page.
If False, the part is hidden and its content is not displayed.

properties.name: class_name
properties.doc:
A list of CSS class names, separated by white spaces, that are associated with the generated HTML Element.
These class names are added to the default taipy-part class name.

properties.name: page
properties.doc:
The page to show as the content of the block (page name if defined or a URL in an iframe).
This should not be defined if partial is set.

properties.name: height
properties.doc: The height, in CSS units, of this block.

properties.name: content
properties.doc: The content provided to the part. See the documentation section on content providers.

properties.name: title
properties.doc: Title of this block element.

properties.name: expanded
properties.doc:
If True, the block is expanded, and the content is displayed.
If False, the block is collapsed and its content is hidden.

properties.name: open
properties.doc: If True, the dialog is visible. If False, it is hidden.

properties.name: on_action
properties.doc:
Name of a function triggered when a button is pressed.
The parameters of that function are all optional:
  • state (State^): the state instance.
  • id (str): the identifier of the dialog.
  • payload (dict): the details on this callback's invocation.
    This dictionary has the following keys:
    • action: the name of the action that triggered this callback.
    • args: a list where the first element contains the index of the selected label.

properties.name: close_label
properties.doc: The tooltip of the top-right close icon button. In the on_action callback, args will be set to -1.

properties.name: labels
properties.doc: A list of labels to show in a row of buttons at the bottom of the dialog. The index of the button in the list is reported as args in the on_action callback (that index is -1 for the close icon).

properties.name: width
properties.doc:
The width, in CSS units, of this dialog.
(CSS property)

properties.name: height
properties.doc:
The height, in CSS units, of this dialog.
(CSS property)

properties.name: columns
properties.doc:
The list of weights for each column.
For example, `"1 2"` creates a 2 column grid:
  • 1fr
  • 2fr

The creation of multiple same size columns can be simplified by using the multiply sign eg. "5*1" is equivalent to "1 1 1 1 1".

properties.name: columns[mobile]
properties.doc:
The list of weights for each column, when displayed on a mobile device.
The syntax is the same as for columns.

properties.name: gap
properties.doc: The size of the gap between the columns.

properties.name: open
properties.doc:
If True, this pane is visible on the page.
If False, the pane is hidden.

properties.name: on_close
properties.doc:
The name of a function that is triggered when this pane is closed (if the user clicks outside of it or presses the Esc key).
All parameters of that function are optional:
  • state (State^): the state instance.
  • id (optional[str]): the identifier of the button.

If this property is not set, no function is called when this pane is closed.

properties.name: anchor
properties.doc:
Anchor side of the pane.
Valid values are "left", "right", "top", or "bottom".

properties.name: width
properties.doc:
Width, in CSS units, of this pane.
This is used only if anchor is "left" or "right".

properties.name: height
properties.doc:
Height, in CSS units, of this pane.
This is used only if anchor is "top" or "bottom".

properties.name: persistent
properties.doc:
If False, the pane covers the page where it appeared and disappears if the user clicks in the page.
If True, the pane appears next to the page. Note that the parent section of the pane must have the flex display mode set. See below for an example using the persistent property.

properties.name: active
properties.doc:
Indicates if this component is active.
An inactive component allows no user interaction.

properties.name: value
properties.doc: Bound to the selection value.

properties.name: lov
properties.doc: The list of values. See the section on List of Values for details.

properties.name: adapter
properties.doc: The function that transforms an element of lov into a tuple(id:str, label:str|Icon).

properties.name: type
properties.doc:
Must be specified if lov contains a non-specific type of data (ex: dict).
value must be of that type, lov must be an iterable on this type, and the adapter function will receive an object of this type.

properties.name: value_by_id
properties.doc: If False, the selection value (in value) is the selected element in lov. If set to True, then value is set to the id of the selected element in lov.

properties.name: on_change
properties.doc:
The name of a function that is triggered when the value is updated.
The parameters of that function are all optional:
  • state (State^): the state instance.
  • var_name (str): the variable name.
  • value (any): the new value.

properties.name: partial
properties.doc:
A Partial object that holds the content of the block.
This should not be defined if page is set.

properties.name: page
properties.doc:
The page name to show as the content of the block.
This should not be defined if partial is set.

properties.name: propagate
properties.doc:
Allows the control's main value to be automatically propagated.
The default value is defined at the application configuration level.
If True, any change to the control's value is immediately reflected in the bound application variable.

properties.name: change_delay
properties.doc:
Minimum time between triggering two calls to the on_change callback.
The default value is defined at the application configuration level by the change_delay configuration option. if None, the delay is set to 300 ms.
If set to -1, the input change is triggered only when the user presses the Enter key.

properties.name: on_action
properties.doc:
Name of a function that is triggered when a specific key is pressed.
The parameters of that function are all optional:
  • state (State^): the state instance.
  • id (str): the identifier of the input.
  • payload (dict): the details on this callback's invocation.
    This dictionary has the following keys:
    • action: the name of the action that triggered this callback.
    • args (list):
      • key name
      • variable name
      • current value

properties.name: action_keys
properties.doc:
Semicolon (';')-separated list of supported key names.
Authorized values are Enter, Escape, F1, F2, F3, F4, F5, F6, F7, F8, F9, F10, F11, F12.

properties.name: id
properties.doc: The identifier that is assigned to the rendered HTML component.

properties.name: properties
properties.doc: Bound to a dictionary that contains additional properties for this element.

properties.name: class_name
properties.doc:
The list of CSS class names that are associated with the generated HTML Element.
These class names are added to the default taipy-<element_type> class name.

properties.name: hover_text
properties.doc: The information that is displayed when the user hovers over this element.
